content: Here's a quiz for you. What famous person took his wife to New York on a small lear jet along with reporters on two other lear jets, had a nice dinner and watched a Broadway show all at taxpayers expense while many Americans are out of work and companies are going bankrupt. Here's a hint. This is the same famous person that had pizza flown in from Indiana to the White House at taxpayers expense several weeks ago.

title: Dinner

title: Dinner

content: President Obama's motorcade slipped out of the White House complex at 12:26 p.m. Tuesday, crossed the Potomac River into Arlington, Va., and came to a stop five minutes later at Ray's Hell-Burger, an independent prime-beef burger joint where you order at the counter, sit at wooden tables and pay $6.95 for a burger. "You guys are cheap dates," Obama said. "I can't believe I couldn't get more of you to order a burger." "http://www.usatoday.com/news/washington/2009-05-05-burger_N.htm"

content: I do not consider this a perk. This is a total waste of taxpayers money. What do you think that it cost the taxpayer for the POTUS and his wife and reporters, aides, secret service and what not to travel on three planes to New York for dinner and a broadway play? There are many broadway style plays playing in the Washington D.C. area that the president could have attended for much less output of the taxpayers money. Especially when the President chastised the CEO'S of the car makers for flying to Washington D.C. on company jets. And also when so many Americans are out of work and doing without any perks!
reply: I do not consider this a perk. This is a total waste of taxpayers money. What do you think that it cost the taxpayer for the POTUS and his wife and reporters, aides, secret service and what not to travel on three planes to New York for dinner and a broadway play? There are many broadway style plays playing in the Washington D.C. area that the president could have attended for much less output of the taxpayers money. Especially when the President chastised the CEO'S of the car makers for flying to Washington D.C. on company jets. And also when so many Americans are out of work and doing without any perks!
title: Dinner

content: quote: Originally posted by Vanir97: I do not consider this a perk. This is a total waste of taxpayers money. What do you think that it cost the taxpayer for the POTUS and his wife and reporters, aides, secret service and what not to travel on three planes to New York for dinner and a broadway play? There are many broadway style plays playing in the Washington D.C. area that the president could have attended for much less output of the taxpayers money. Especially when the President chastised the CEO'S of the car makers for flying to Washington D.C. on company jets. And also when so many Americans are out of work and doing without any perks! He is the President. He has the authority to use those aircraft. He has a duty to also be a husband. And keep in mind that the President cannot just hop onto a commercial flight at his own expense and fly out to have a night on the town with his wife. For one thing, the Secret Service would not allow him to use a commercial airlines filled with other citizens. He legally used those aircraft, broke no laws in the use of them, committed no crimes in the use of the aircraft and did not violate any rules of etiquette and cooperated with the Secret Service. President Bush made that carrier landing, mission complete visit and no one here complained about what that cost the taxpayers. And by the way, President Obama and his wife were allowed an expenditure of about $100,000 to redecorate their living quarters. The President and his wife gave that money back to the taxpayers and redecorated at their own expense. And another thing, President Obama has requested a pay hike for military Chapter 61 retirees. Perhaps he was working on that while flying to Broadway with his wife. Frankly, I think he is setting a good example for all the young people by showing how much he respects and loves his wife. And if he wants to entertain his wife in New York rather than D.C., that is his perogative and no taxpayer has any say so in it. The only ones who have any say is the Secret Service and that is limited. The only ones complaining are the sour grapers.

reply: He is the President. He has the authority to use those aircraft. He has a duty to also be a husband. For one thing, the Secret Service would not allow him to use a commercial airlines filled with other citizens. He legally used those aircraft, broke no laws in the use of them, committed no crimes in the use of the aircraft and did not violate any rules of etiquette and cooperated with the Secret Service. President Bush made that carrier landing, mission complete visit and no one here complained about what that cost the taxpayers. And by the way, President Obama and his wife were allowed an expenditure of about $100,000 to redecorate their living quarters. The President and his wife gave that money back to the taxpayers and redecorated at their own expense. And another thing, President Obama has requested a pay hike for military Chapter 61 retirees. Perhaps he was working on that while flying to Broadway with his wife. Frankly, I think he is setting a good example for all the young people by showing how much he respects and loves his wife. And if he wants to entertain his wife in New York rather than D.C., that is his perogative and no taxpayer has any say so in it. The only ones who have any say is the Secret Service and that is limited. The only ones complaining are the sour grapers.
